alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 8:52PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Cheyenne and southwestern Kit Carson Counties in east central Colorado through 945 PM MDT... At 852 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 17 miles south of Flagler to 12 miles east of Karval. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of western Cheyenne and southwestern Kit Carson Counties in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Wild Horse, Firstview and Aroya. This includes Highway 385 near mile marker 162. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
